name: heart-api
description: API that can be used to retrieve various data that is found in a variety of places. An ideal use case is to retrieve social media information for specific services.

scripts.gh:test: echo $HEART_API_TEST_ENV > .env-cmdrc.json && bash doppler-secrets-gh-setup.sh && sudo npm test
scripts.mutation: NODE_OPTIONS='--loader ts-node/esm' env-cmd -e test stryker run config/stryker.conf.json
scripts.integration-test: source integration-test/jwt.sh && NODE_OPTIONS='--loader ts-node/esm' env-cmd -e test cucumber-js --config config/cucumber.mjs
scripts.start: env-cmd -e dev nodemon --ext ts --exec node --loader ts-node/esm ./src/app.ts
scripts.start:prod: env-cmd -e prod nodemon --ext ts --exec node --loader ts-node/esm ./src/app.ts
scripts.start:prod-build: npm run build && cd ./dist && env-cmd -e prod node -r ts-node/register ./src/app.js
scripts.start:docker: npm install --global env-cmd && env-cmd -e prod node -r ts-node/register ./src/app.js
scripts.build: rm -rf dist && tsc && cp ./package.json ./dist && cp ./.env-cmdrc.json ./dist && cp -r ./certs ./dist && cp ./tsconfig.json ./dist

author: Javi Gomez
